name: Burleigh Court

reviews.title: Good no frills hotel,
reviews.text: Stayed here overnight before a conference at the university. I had a nice room,on the ground floor, comfortable bed, a lot of power points - which was great, together with excellent broadband. Breakfast was good, wide range of items in offer. Good parking close to the building. No frills but good comfortable accommodation, helpful staff and good food (breakfast). I arrived too late to try out the pool and other spa activities so can't comment on those. I think it's a bit generous to describe this as a 4* and I think the prices a bit high (I paid £120 w/breakfast)

By the standards of university conference centers, Burleigh Court is certainly on the upper end. Situated atop a high bluff at the center of the Loughborough University campus, this hotel offers not only immaculately clean facilities but also abundant fresh air and walking opportunities. That having been said, other elements of what might be called "the university idiom" reduce the ranking of this otherwise superb facility. These deficits include extremely spare room decor; uncomfortably narrow toilets and bathroom spaces; and a certain penury with regard to amenities (only one towel was provided). The hotel is affiliated with a university that stresses sports education; as a result, the halls are filled with annoying banners proclaiming certain sports-related virtues and showing athletes in somewhat artificial action poses. Although the breakfast is superior in every respect, from taste to quantity to presentation, the other food service, whether in the restaurant or through catering, is appalling (I was confronted with a rubbery lamb shank that truly defined the "spring" in "spring lamb"). The Burleigh Court offers numerous advantages but has not yet achieved the consistent level of quality and amenity needed for a true four-star hotel.
reviews.title: Cheerful but not Quite a Four-Star

reviews.text: I stayed here overnight when attending a Development Day organised by the charity with whom I volunteer. Our room had all the amenities we would need and was spotlessly clean, with comfortable beds and (one of my particular idiosyncrasies!) good quality, decent-sized towels in the bathroom. Dinner in the restaurant was excellent, as was breakfast the next morning. The staff, without exception, were pleasant, helpful and courteous, always greeting you with a smile, even when just passing you in the corridor. There was a small problem at check-in because a double room instead of a twin had been reserved for us, but this was soon dealt with in a professional and appropriate manner. I would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel.
reviews.title: Very pleasant place to stay

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night o/a work. Reception and waiting staff were very nice and helpful. Nice restaurant with good food for dinner and great choice for breakfast. Room was small and basic but clean. I was in The Lodge and found that noise carried greatly so was woken a number of times during the night as people returned to their rooms.
reviews.title: Pleasant staff but thin walls!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I visited this hotel on the bank holiday of August and it was a nice hotel. Fairly quiet for a bank holiday and oddly in the grounds of the Loughborough University so not a great location for going out and about however there is everything needed within the hotel. The spa is included for guests and has a pool, jacuzzi, steam & sauna rooms. The rooms were very clean and modern
reviews.title: Pretty good

reviews.text: Teenager was doing trials at Loughborough so we needed to stay close by. Brilliant location (once we had found it - it was late). Plenty of parking and a secure environment. Rooms like a premier Inn rather than a 4* hotel but adequate for what we wanted. Shower was good and plenty of towels. Breakfast was amazing lots of choice and attentive staff. The leisure facilities were good. Husband said it was one of the best Gyms he had used. I used the pool. It could do with a clean as there is green mould growing on the far side tiles in the cracks and the showers seemed a bit dated. All in all good value for money and we would stay again when we are up there.
reviews.title: Like a premier Inn only with a leisure complex

reviews.text: Stayed here with 3 others one weekend in October. Although we booked two twin rooms, we were given two doubles, but that was quickly sorted with the addition of another double at no extra charge. The rooms were clean and the spa facilities good - we had the pool to ourselves.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: Reunion 1 night eve meal and breakfast. Spotless clean bright and airy. Easy check in lovely staff. The room lovely with super comfy bed. It has all you need. Drinks and food pricey but expected in a hotel. No one minded us stopping up late chatting. Spoilt by a punch up from a wedding party. With jeremy kyle show types! The young staff handled it really well. Security was called ... What a joke! Useless the instigator stayed the injured led away. A gobby woman stayed. One man taken to his room repeatedly then he kept returning and punching the windows. Security did nothing.After 2 hours and having to close the bar because of them , they eventually went. They needed chucking out. In spite of this we really enjoyed our stay .The dinner was delicious and quality. Great choice at breakfast. Great service with a smile. Strange was we all payed very different prices for the same rooms . Mine being the dearest. However I will definately stay again in the future. Shame about the drunk as a skunk party
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.text: Lovely experience, very friendly and professional staff, location and parking just perfect. Book early to get the best deals. Pleasant restaurant, very attentive staff and quite reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Overnight for Uni Drop Off

reviews.text: Rooms, clean and tidy, comfy bed and pillows! Tea and Coffee making facilites with a selection of teas, hot chocolate, coffees etc, and more than a single milk carton!
reviews.title: Good Hotel for Buisness

reviews.text: The staff were fabulous. the reception very inviting. Bedrooms good. The thing is that having worked for many years in Universities, sitting in the lounge and the dining room was like sitting in student settings not a hotel. No subtle lighting or beautiful furniture. For the most part, ceiling lights ( as you would in a student common room) and upright student kind of chairs ( in the dining room) The lounge was the same and I had to wear ear plugs as the TV was blaring out ( audio) the football commentary as you would find in a pub not a four star hotel. So suggest they visit some of the most beautiful hotel lounges e.g Peacock Alley in The Caledonian Edinburgh or the lounge in The Goring London. Whilst these are 5 star, some of the features of subtle hotel lighting, plants etc, could be an inspiration. Until this changes I won't be returning as I want to relax in a hotel lounge not a student common room
reviews.title: Identity confusion: student common room or hotel!

reviews.text: I was working in Loughborough and googled nearby hotels with a gym and the Burleigh Court Hotel came up as an option. It was probably not one of my greatest decisions but I decided to stay for 3 nights. Firstly the gym is very small and gets really busy after 5 however all the machines were clean and in good working order. There was not a great choice in the restaurant and on one night there was a long wait but the staff were friendly and apologetic and I even got a drink on the house because of the wait. All the meals that I had were superb so perhaps the lack of choice is made up by the quality. Perhaps a conference hotel was not the best choice because I was on my own and the hotel is obviously trying to cater for large groups. The hotel rooms are very small for the money and even came with an apologetic note next to the bed about the location of the hotel being on the University Campus and sorry about the loud noises but here are a set of earplugs if you need them! Luckily I didn't. My only problem with the hotel is that I was in the dorm annex that is a long way away from reception and twice my room card did not work. The second time I had finished work and had a drink in my hand but could not get in the room and couldn't get back into the main hotel to get to reception because the outside door required my room card to open it. This time I had been to meetings in Nottingham and knew for a fact that my card had been nowhere near a mobile phone which wipes them. In fact both times the card failed to open the room it had opened the outside door to the dorm complex only seconds before. I know you can phone through to reception but how long would they take to get there? The only benefit of this was that a ten minute walk to reception and back made up for the fact that I could not use the gym as it was too busy! All in all a good hotel but somewhere to go for a company conference and not if there is only one or two of you.
reviews.title: Don't bother if your not on a conference

reviews.text: Stayed at Burleigh Court for two nights. Check-in was very smooth and professional, and all necessary points were highlighted, ie internet and exit codes, meal timings and locations.
reviews.title: Excellent.

reviews.text: The gym was very good; which is something I always look for, and includes a good selection of Technogym equipment, as well as weight machines.
reviews.title: Will always stay here when in the area!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very comfortable, and I managed to have two good nights sleep.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: nice hotel, very much a corporate feel to it and rooms are a long walk. Good value for money, best rates seem to be on laterooms. would stay here again if needing a hotel in the Loughborough area. Also good location for nearby wedding venues. comfortable sized room and lovely bed and shower.
reviews.title: nice stay

reviews.text: Like a previous reviewer, we stayed for one night for the University open day. The hotel couldnt have been in a better position.
reviews.title: Very handy for University

reviews.text: We had a slight problem when booking in. We booked through Bookings.com and it seems as though the communication between them and the hotel hadnt worked quite properly and I was worried that we wouldnt be able to stay. However, the very helpful and friendly receptionist sorted it all out for us.
reviews.title: Superb facilities and value for money

reviews.text: Rooms were large, modern and clean and beds comfortable. The lounge and bar area is quite "stark and bright" but functional. We had a bar meal which was fine and the breakfast in the morning was lovely. Book beforehand at £10 or £15 on the day. Maybe a little expensive but a very good choice and quality.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel for visiting Loughborough University

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We managed to get a very good deal through Booking.com. Not certain that I would pay the full amount for this type of trip (but thats only because I try to do things on a budget)
reviews.title: Nothing special

aka: Imago At Burleigh Court Hotel Loughborough
